body_content.explanation: not closed with a bolt (= a metal bar on a door or window that slides across to lock it):
examples: Someone had left the gate to the yard unbolted and thieves got in during the night and stole a large amount of copper piping.
The unbolted door had worked open and was banging in the wind.

body_content.explanation: (of flour) that has not been put through a sieve (= a wire net shaped like a bowl) to break up or remove large pieces:
examples: Wholewheat flour is an example of unbolted flour.
This old recipe uses 500 g of unbolted flour.
